document_title: Congenital metabolic disorders: Causes, symptoms, treatment
subsection_content:
Congenital metabolic disorders often develop in newborns or children under 12 months of age. Symptoms of the disease depend on the severity and type of metabolic disorder the baby is suffering from. Usually children will not have any symptoms until they receive nutrients from outside.
Children with congenital metabolic disorders often have fever, fatigue, and lethargic eyes
Symptoms of congenital metabolic disorders are quite similar to the manifestations of many other diseases, making it difficult for families and doctors to differentiate, recognize and diagnose the disease. Some common symptoms:
Children are tired and lethargic; Loss of appetite, loss of appetite; Stop breathing or shortness of breath; Abdomen is distended, abdominal pain; Urine, saliva, breath, sweat are abnormal, have an unpleasant odor; Fever, coma; Jaundice; Weight loss, slow growth; Convulsions and epilepsy appear; Diarrhea, dehydration; Heart arrhythmia
